page.title: 13TRADITIONS (continued).
page.content: {WORDS SELDOM USED. athert - out of line. doust - husks left after threshing. dummon - a woman. echymile - bluetit. fore - furrow. runk - coarse (vegetation). scote - to spread manure. vautch - to drag the feet. vuzz - gorse. wap - cattle worried by warblefly wassick - eccentric person. withy - willow or water alder. {LOCAL FIELD NAMES.} These days most farmers identify their individual fields by numbers, but in our area, most fields have traditional names which often bear some relation to landmarks in the area,size,position or the home farm and its inhabitants. Some,eg.pylon field, have been more recently named.
